export_format.description: Export is packaged as a ZIP file containing: (1) HL7 v2.5.1 result messages in .txt files (one per patient/export run), (2) XML billing history files from SoftBill/SoftAR, and (3) linked documents from SoftMedia (PDF reports, images, etc.). The ZIP also includes a ReadMe with links to the format specifications. This is a laboratory information system — the export covers lab results, microbiology, blood bank, pathology, genetics, and billing. It does NOT cover general EHR domains like appointments, secure messages, or problem lists because SCC is a LIMS, not a full EHR.

documentation.table_or_resource_count_note: 14 HL7 segment types documented (MSH, PID, NK1, PV1, IN1, ORC, OBR, DG1, SPM, OBX with multiple variants, NTE, FHS, FTS, BHS) plus XML billing schema with ~30 elements. Not traditional database tables — these are HL7 message segments and XML elements.

clinical.evidence: Core purpose of the export. HL7 v2.5.1 messages carry lab results across SoftLab (clinical chemistry), SoftMic (microbiology — exams, cultures, organisms, sensitivities), SoftBank (blood bank — products, actions, units), SoftPathDx (pathology — narrative/discrete format), and SoftGene (genetics). OBX segments carry observations with values, units, reference ranges, abnormal flags, result status. OBR carries ordered test info. SPM carries specimen data.

secure_messages.evidence: No mention of patient portal, secure messaging, inbox, or patient-provider communication in any document. SCC is a laboratory system — it does not have a patient messaging module.

billing_financial.evidence: Dedicated XML billing history export documented in separate 14-page PDF. Covers invoices, charges (CPT codes, CDM codes, modifiers, ICD-10 diagnosis codes, quantity, charge amount, paid amount, balance), and transactions (invoicing, billing, payments, voids, adjustments). Includes ordering/rendering provider with NPI, performing lab NPI and CLIA. Example XML shows MEDICARE payor with charge/payment/balance detail.

insurance_coverage.evidence: IN1 segment documented in HL7 result spec with fields for Insurance Plan ID, Insurance Company ID, Set ID/Insurance Priority (primary/secondary/tertiary). Billing XML includes payor description (e.g. 'MEDICARE') at transaction level. Coverage is limited to what's needed for lab billing — not full insurance demographics.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No appointment or scheduling data. PV1 segment carries visit/encounter context (visit number, patient class, attending/referring physician, admit date) but this is the lab order context, not appointment scheduling. SCC is a LIMS — it does not manage appointment scheduling.

documents_images.evidence: SoftMedia integration exports linked documents alongside HL7 results. Supports PDF, RTF, JPEG, TIFF, BMP, TXT, PNG, HTML, XML and other file types. Documents linked to ordered tests, procedures, or individual components are exported. Examples include PDF reference lab reports and images associated with component results. Files named as <patient_mrn>_<order/case/procedure_number>_<unique_document_ID>_<date>T<time>.

audit_trails.evidence: The export utility itself has an audit trail of export runs ('Show audit' button), but the exported data does not include system audit trails or access logs. Only one mention of audit in docs, referring to the export tool's own run history.

sample_exports_note: The billing history PDF includes a complete example XML output message with realistic test data (patient demographics, two charge items with CPT codes, three transactions including invoicing, billing, and check payment). The HL7 result PDF documents segment structures with field-level detail but does not include a complete sample HL7 message.

downloaded_files.description: HL7 v2.5.1 Result Reporting interface specification for release 4.0.x
XML Billing History export specification for release 4.0.x
HL7 v2.5.1 Result Reporting interface specification for release 4.5.x
XML Billing History export specification for release 4.5.x
Saved copy of the EHI Export landing page

issues: SCC is a Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS), not a general-purpose EHR. The EHI export only covers data domains relevant to laboratory operations: clinical lab results, microbiology, blood bank, pathology, genetics, and lab billing. It inherently cannot export data it doesn't manage (appointments, medications, problem lists, secure messages, etc.).
Bulk/population export requires contacting SCC services — it is not self-service. Single-patient export is self-service via EhiExportConsole.
Billing export only includes charges processed through SoftBill/SoftAR. Charges sent to external billing systems are explicitly excluded.
Document export from SoftMedia only includes files linked at the test/procedure/component level — documents linked to patient, stay, or order records are NOT exported.
The 4.0 and 4.5 documents are versioned separately for different software releases but follow the same structure and format.
summary: SCC Soft Computer provides well-documented EHI export specifications for their SoftLab LIMS suite. The export produces a ZIP containing HL7 v2.5.1 messages (lab results across clinical chemistry, microbiology, blood bank, pathology, and genetics), XML billing history (charges, payments, transactions with CPT/ICD-10 codes), and linked documents from SoftMedia. Documentation is thorough at the field level with data types, cardinality, and business rules for each HL7 segment. However, as a laboratory system, the export scope is inherently narrow compared to a full EHR — no medications, problem lists, appointments, or secure messages exist in the system to export.
